reasoning: GSD type Ic (G6PT deficiency) is extremely rare. GSD type I overall occurs in ~1 per 100k births, with type Ic representing ~10-15% of GSD-I cases. Estimated <0.015 per 100k births based on case series.
source: Chou JY et al. (2002). Type I glycogen storage diseases: disorders of the glucose-6-phosphatase complex. Curr Mol Med. 2(2):121-43
